poem:
**The Dance of Digits**  

Between the ink and paper's crease,  
a cipher hides in twists and loops,  
where ones become sevens,  
sixes doff their hats to eights.  
In this ballet of ballots,  
AI muses whisper truth,  
translating the dance of digits  
into the language of last hopes  
and new beginnings.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Decoding a voter’s poor handwriting is subjective – let’s enlist AI to help with the Bradfield recount | Simon Jackman Liberal candidate Gisele Kapterian has appealed her narrow loss to Nicolette Boele in Bradfield to the court of disputed returns. According to Professor Anne Twomey, no questions of law are raised in Kapterian’s challenge. Rather, the court is being asked to determine more mundane questions. Is that 1 actually a 7; is that 6 an". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.

Is that 1 actually a 7; is that 6 an
